snippet: American output had its biggest increase in six months and New York State factory activity has expanded this month in signs of an economy gaining momentum.
abstract: American manufacturing output records its biggest increase in six months in February 2014 and New York State factory activity expands early in March, latest signs that the economy is gaining momentum; reports will likely encourage Federal Reserve to further scale back its economic stimulus program.
lead_paragraph: American output had its biggest increase in six months and New York State factory activity has expanded this month in signs of an economy gaining momentum.

headline.main: Factory Gains Likely to Spur Fed to Ease Its Stimulus
headline.print_headline: Factory Gains Likely to Spur Fed to Ease Its Stimulus
